newsitem.title: RUSSIA: SOCCER-RUSSIANS GET 10-MATCH BANS FOR ATTACKING REF.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-RUSSIANS GET 10-MATCH BANS FOR ATTACKING REF.

text.p: Two players from Russian first division side Lokomotiv Chita were banned for 10 games by the league disciplinary committee on Monday after assaulting the referee in a match last week.
The referee was also sanctioned by the referee's panel and will face a league disciplinary hearing later. One player from Chita's opponents, Uralan Elista, was banned for five games.
The two clubs were each fined 10 million roubles ($1,700) and warned they would face more serious penalties if there was any repeat of the sort of melee seen on May 12.
